data.title: Rod Stewart With Jools Holland
data.meta_description: Rod Stewart is a British rock singer and songwriter known for his distinctive raspy voice and charismatic stage presence. Born on January 10, 1945, in London, England, Stewart began his music career in the 1960s as a member of several bands, including The Jeff Beck Group and Faces, before launching a successful solo career. Stewart’s solo career took off in the early 1970s with hit songs like “Maggie May,” “You Wear It Well,” and “Tonight’s the Night.” He quickly became known for his soulful voice and his ability to blend rock, folk, and blues influences into his music. Over the years, Stewart has released numerous albums and singles that have topped the charts around the world. Jools Holland is a British pianist, bandleader, and television presenter known for his energetic and eclectic approach to music. Born on January 24, 1958, in London, England, Holland began his music career in the late 1970s as a member of the band Squeeze before launching a successful solo career as a jazz and blues pianist. Holland is perhaps best known for his work as the bandleader and host of the BBC music program “Later… with Jools Holland,” which has featured a wide range of musical guests from various genres. He is also known for his collaborations with other artists, including Rod Stewart. Together, Rod Stewart and Jools Holland have performed on stage and in the studio, showcasing their musical talents and bringing their unique styles together to create memorable performances. Their collaboration has brought together Stewart’s rock sensibilities with Holland’s jazz and blues influences, resulting in dynamic and engaging music that has delighted audiences around the world. Whether performing together or pursuing their own solo projects, Rod Stewart and Jools Holland continue to be influential figures in the music industry, inspiring generations of fans with their talent, passion, and dedication to creating timeless music.
data.text:
Biography

Rod Stewart is a British rock singer and songwriter known for his distinctive raspy voice and charismatic stage presence. Born on January 10, 1945, in London, England, Stewart began his music career in the 1960s as a member of several bands, including The Jeff Beck Group and Faces, before launching a successful solo career.

Stewart’s solo career took off in the early 1970s with hit songs like “Maggie May,” “You Wear It Well,” and “Tonight’s the Night.” He quickly became known for his soulful voice and his ability to blend rock, folk, and blues influences into his music. Over the years, Stewart has released numerous albums and singles that have topped the charts around the world.

Jools Holland is a British pianist, bandleader, and television presenter known for his energetic and eclectic approach to music. Born on January 24, 1958, in London, England, Holland began his music career in the late 1970s as a member of the band Squeeze before launching a successful solo career as a jazz and blues pianist.

Holland is perhaps best known for his work as the bandleader and host of the BBC music program “Later… with Jools Holland,” which has featured a wide range of musical guests from various genres. He is also known for his collaborations with other artists, including Rod Stewart.

Together, Rod Stewart and Jools Holland have performed on stage and in the studio, showcasing their musical talents and bringing their unique styles together to create memorable performances. Their collaboration has brought together Stewart’s rock sensibilities with Holland’s jazz and blues influences, resulting in dynamic and engaging music that has delighted audiences around the world.

Whether performing together or pursuing their own solo projects, Rod Stewart and Jools Holland continue to be influential figures in the music industry, inspiring generations of fans with their talent, passion, and dedication to creating timeless music.
